data.title: The Changing Sound of Music: Approaches to Studying Recorded Musical Performances
data.text:
Sound File 1: Ignacy Paderewski: Chopin, Mazurka Op. 59 no. 2, bb.101-11. Matrix A64336 (rec. 23 December 1930), issued on HMV DA 1245, 2â22â-2â41â. Transfer Â© Kingâs College London 2007.

Sound File 2: Harry Plunkett-Green: Schubert, âThe Hurdy-Gurdy Manâ (âDer Leiermannâ). Matrix CA 14259-1 (rec. 10 January 1934), issued on Columbia DB 1377. Transfer Â© Kingâs College London 2007.

Sound File 4: Frieda Hempel, accompanied by an unidentified ensemble: Schubert, âAve Mariaâ (Ellens Gesang III). Matrix 341 av (rec. 1921), issued on Deutsche Grammophon 043370. Transfer Â© Karsten Lehl and Kingâs College London 2007.

Sound File 5: Albert Piccaluga, acc. Mr. Pickaert (Mustel harmonium): Schubert âAve Mariaâ (Ellens Gesang III). Matrix xP 1317 (rec. April 1905), issued on Odeon 36034. Transfer Â© Karsten Lehl 2007.

Sound File 5a: As Sound File 5, but with digital noise reduction by Andrew Hallifax. Transfer Â© Karsten Lehl and Kingâs College London 2008.

Sound File 6: Germaine Martinelli, acc. orchestra, conducted by EugÃ¨ne Bigot: Schubert, âLa jeune religieuseâ (âDie junge Nonneâ). Columbia matrix CLX 1872-1 (rec. 21 June 1935), issued on LFX 250. Transfer Â© Karsten Lehl and Kingâs College London 2007.

Sound File 6a: As Sound File 6, but with digital noise reduction by Andrew Hallifax. Transfer Â© Karsten Lehl and Kingâs College London 2008.

Sound File 7: Alfred Cortot, London Philharmonic Orchestra, cond. Landon Ronald: Schumann, Piano Concerto, 1st movement, side breaks. HMV DB 7648, matrix 2B6821-2 (end); DB 7649, mat. 2B6822-1A (start & end); DB 7650, mat. 2B6823-1 (start & end); DB 7651, mat. 2B6824-2 (start). Transfer Â© Kingâs College London 2007.

Sound File 9: Edvard Grieg playing his own âNorwegian Bridal Processionâ, (extract). Transferred from G&T 35517 (1903). Transfer Â© currently unknown.

Sound File 12: Carl Reinecke: Mozart Piano Concerto K. 537, 2nd movement (extract). Transferred by Denis Hall (November 2007) from Welte 237 (1905). Transfer Â© Denis Hall 2007.

Sound File 33: Extract from Sound File 13 with more noise reduction.

Sound File 34: MIDI encoding of Chopin, Mazurka in A minor, Op. 17 no. 4, with timings extracted by Craig Sapp from a 1994 performance by Murray Perahia on Sony SK 45931. See http:www.mazurka.org.uk/info/revcond/#17-4. Â© Royal Holloway, University of London 2007.
